Introduction.Name: Dwarfs
Introduction.Annotation: The Dwarfs, also called the "Elder Race" (or the Dawi as they call themselves) are one of the oldest and proudest intelligent races of the Warhammer World, with a great wealth of history and power that stretches back to time immemorial. They once held an empire which stretched from Norsca in the north to the jungles in the south, and from Mount Silverspear in the east to the Grey Mountains in the west. But the heart of the Dwarfen realm, the Karaz Ankor as they call it, will always lie within the domains of the Worlds Edge Mountains. The highest mountain range in the world, it is filled with the magnificent halls and holds of the Dwarfen people - a testament to the great feats of engineering and power once wielded by this ancient civilization.

Artefact.Name: The Hammer of Karak Drazh
Artefact.Rule: Enemy that suffer one or more unsaved Wounds have their own Initiative reduced to 1 until the end of the Close Combat phase
Artefact.Description: Attacks with the Hammer ofKarak Drazh are resolved at +3 Initiative, and any enemy models that suffer one or more unsaved Wounds from it have their own Initiative reduced to 1 until the end of the Close Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: Red Axe of Karak Eight Peaks
Artefact.Description: The Red Axe of Karak Eight Peaks allows its wielder to re-roll To Hit and To Wound rolls against all models from Orcs, Goblins or Skaven. Additionally, the wielder also has the Terror special rule against all Orcs, Goblins or Skaven.

Artefact.Name: Magnificent Armour of Borek Beetlebrow
Artefact.Rule: 3+ Ward save against all attacks of Strength 6+
Artefact.Description: The Magnificent Armour of Borek Beetlebrow grants the wearer a 2+ armour save. In addition, the Armour of Borek Beetlebrow grants the bearer a 3+ ward save against all attacks of Strength 6 or higher.

Artefact.Name: Silver Horn of Vengeance
Artefact.Rule: One use only: at the start of any friendly turn any friendly units within 6", has the Devastating Charge special rule until the start of their following turn, cause Fear in all High Elves, Dark Elves or Wood Elves for the rest of the game
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Silver Horn of Vengeance can be used at the start of any friendly turn. Its wielder, and any friendly units within 6", has the Devastating Charge special rule until the start of their following turn. Additionally, once used, the blower of the Silver Horn of Vengeance, and any unit he joins, cause Fear in all models from Warhammer: High Elves, Dark Elves and/or Wood Elves for the rest of the game.

Artefact.Name: Fiery Ring of Thori
Artefact.Rule: Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule
Artefact.Description: The Fiery Ring ofThori gives its bearer a Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Lost Holds
Artefact.Description: All models in a unit that carries the Banner of Lost Holds can re-roll failed To Wound rolls in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Skalf Blackhammer
Artefact.Rule: Wound on roll of 2+ (3+ against models in magic armour)
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Skalf Blackhammer will wound any model not in magic armour on a To Wound roll of 2+, regardless of the target's Toughness. Against models in magic armour, a roll of 3+ is required.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Smiting
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Smiting has the Multiple Wounds (D6) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Alaric the Mad
Artefact.Description: Armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by a weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Alaric the Mad.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Breaking
Artefact.Rule: If a Dwarf with a weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Breaking scores one or more successful hits against a model with a magic weapon, the foe's magic weapon is destroyed on a D6 roll of 2+
Artefact.Description: If a Dwarf with a weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Breaking scores one or more successful hits against a model with a magic weapon, the foe's magic weapon is destroyed on a D6 roll of 2+ (roll once, regardless of the number of successful hits). A foe with a destroyed magic weapon counts as being armed with a hand weapon. If the foe has more than one magic weapon (note that Paired weapons count as one), roll a D6 to randomly determine which one is destroyed.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Dragon Slaying
Artefact.Rule: Against a Dragon or Chaos Dragon, a weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Dragon Slaying will always wound on a To Wound roll of 2+ and has the Multiple Wounds (2) special rule
Artefact.Description: Against a Dragon or Chaos Dragon, a weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Dragon Slaying will always wound on a To Wound roll of 2+ and has the Multiple Wounds (2) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Flight
Artefact.Rule: Weapon can be thrown like a throwing weapon with a range of up to 12" which always hits on a roll of 2+ as if the target had suffered a hit from the weapon in close combat
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Flight can be thrown like a throwing weapon with a range of up to 12" which always hits on a roll of 2+. Roll To Wound as if the target had suffered a hit from the weapon in close combat. Any additional runes on the weapon will also take effect. After this, the weapon flies back to the wielder. A weapon with the Master Rune of Flight can also be used in close combat as normal.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Snorri Spangelhelm
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Snorri Spangelhelm always hits on a To Hit roll of 2+.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Swiftness
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with the Master Rune of Swiftness has the Always Strikes First special rule.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Daemon Slaying
Artefact.Rule: Against any Daemons of Chaos receives a +1 bonus To Hit and To Wound
Artefact.Description:
Against any model from Warhammer: Daemons of I Chaos, a weapon engraved with a Rune of Daemon Slaying receives a +1 bonus To Hit and To Wound.

Against any model from Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos, a weapon engraved with two Runes of Daemon Slaying receives a +1 bonus To Hit and To Wound and gains the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule.

Against any model from Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos, a weapon engraved with three Runes of Daemon Slaving hits and wounds on a roll of 2+ , has the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule and no ward saves can be taken against it.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Daemon Slaying
Artefact.Rule: Against any Daemons of Chaos receives a +1 bonus To Hit and To Wound

Artefact.Name: Rune of Daemon Slaying
Artefact.Rule: Against any Daemons of Chaos receives a +1 bonus To Hit and To Wound

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fire
Artefact.Rule: Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description:
A weapon engraved with a Rune of Fire has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

A weapon engraved with two Runes of Fire has the Flaming Attacks special rule, and grants its wielder a Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule.

A weapon engraved with three Runes of Fire has the Flaming Attacks special rule, and grants its wielder a Strength 4 Breath Weapon that has the Flaming Attacks and Multiple Wounds (D3) special rules.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fire
Artefact.Rule: Flaming Attacks
Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fire
Artefact.Rule: Flaming Attacks
Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fury
Artefact.Description:
A weapon engraved with a Rune of Fury grants its wielder +1 Attack.

A weapon engraved with two Runes of Fury grants its wielder +1 Attack and the Frenzy special rule.

A weapon engraved with three Runes of Fury grants its wielder +1 Attack and the Frenzy special rule and, after each successful roll To Hit, it grants its user another Attack; roll To Hit and To Wound as normal. Attacks generated in this way do not generate further Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fury
Artefact.Rule: After each successful roll To Hit, it grants its user another Attack; roll To Hit and To Wound as normal; attacks generated in this way do not generate further Attacks

Artefact.Name: Rune of Dismay
Artefact.Description:
A weapon engraved with a Rune of Dismay grants its wielder the Fear special rule.

A weapon engraved with two Runes of Dismay grants its wielder the Terror special rule.

A weapon engraved with three Runes of Dismay grants its wielder the Terror special rule. In addition, any enemy units that are in base contact with the wielder suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Dismay
Artefact.Rule: Any enemy units that are in base contact suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership

Artefact.Name: Rune of Cleaving
Artefact.Description:
A weapon engraved with a Rune of Cleaving has the Armour Piercing special rule.

A weapon engraved with two Runes of Cleaving has the Armour Piercing special rule, and additionally grants its wielder +1 Strength.

A weapon engraved with three Runes of Cleaving has the Armour Piercing special rule, and additionally grants its wielder +1 Strength and the Killing Blow special rule.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Might
Artefact.Rule: Doubles Strength against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with a Rune of Might doubles its wielder's Strength against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat.\n\nA weapon engraved with two Runes of Might maintains the previous effect, and grants the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat. A third Rune of Might has no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Might
Artefact.Rule: Doubles Strength against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat
Multiple Wounds (D3) against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat

Artefact.Name: Rune of Striking
Artefact.Description:
A weapon engraved with a Rune of Striking grants its wielder +1 Weapon Skill.

A weapon engraved with two Runes of Striking grants its wielder +1 Weapon Skill and allows its wielder to re-roll failed To Hit rolls in close combat.

A weapon engraved with three Runes of Striking grants its wielder Weapon Skill 10 and allows him to re-roll failed To Hit rolls in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Grudge Rune
Artefact.Rule: For each Grudge Rune in your army, nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game: the wielder of a weapon engraved with a Grudge Rune gains +1 To Hit and can re-roll failed To Wound rolls in close combat when attacking the nominated model
Artefact.Description: For each Grudge Rune in your army, nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game. The wielder of a weapon engraved with a Grudge Rune gains +1 To Hit and can re-roll failed To Wound rolls in close combat when attacking the nominated model. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Parrying
Artefact.Description: For each Grudge Rune in your army, nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game. The wielder of a weapon engraved with a Grudge Rune gains +1 To Hit and can re-roll failed To Wound rolls in close combat when attacking the nominated model. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Speed
Artefact.Description: A weapon engraved with a Rune of Speed grants its wielder +1 Initiative.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Adamant
Artefact.Description: A model wearing armour engraved with the Master Rune of Adamant has Toughness 10. This rune cannot he combined with any other armour runes.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Gromril
Artefact.Description: Armour engraved with the Master Rune of Gromril grants its wearer a 1+ armour save that cannot be improved upon in any way.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fortitude
Artefact.Description:
Armour engraved with a Rune of Fortitude grants its wearer +1 Toughness.

Armour engraved with two Runes of Fortitude grants its wearer +1 Toughness and a 5+ ward save.

Armour engraved with three Runes of Fortitude grants its wearer +1 Toughness and a 5+ ward save and, if the wearer suffers an unsaved Wound from an attack that has Multiple Wounds special rule, roll a D6. On a roll of 2+, he only suffers 1 Wound, regardless of how many Wounds would normally be caused; on a roll of 1, he suffers the full number of Wounds.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Fortitude
Artefact.Rule: If the wearer suffers an unsaved Wound from an attack that has Multiple Wounds special rule, roll a D6: on a roll of 2+, he only suffers 1 Wound

Artefact.Name: Rune of Iron
Artefact.Description:
Armour engraved with a Rune of Iron grants its wearer +1 Wound.

Armour engraved with two Runes of Iron grants its wearer +1 Wound and +1 Toughness.

Armour engraved with three Runes of Iron grants its wearer + 1 Wound, +1 Toughness and the Regeneration (5+) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Shielding
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against Wounds caused by shooting attacks and all magic missiles
Artefact.Description: Armour engraved with a Rune of Shielding grants its wearer a 2+ Ward save against Wounds caused by shooting attacks and all magic missiles. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Preservation
Artefact.Description: Armour engraved with a Rune of Preservation grants the wearer a 2+ Ward save against the effects of the Killing Blow and Heroic Killing Blow special rules. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Impact
Artefact.Description: Armour engraved with a Rune of Impact grants its wearer the Impact Hits (1) special rule. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Stone
Artefact.Description: Armour engraved with a Rune of Stone adds +1 to its wearer's armour save. Multiples of this rune have no further effect. The Rune of Stone is an exception to the Rule of Pride, meaning several characters can wear gromril armour engraved with a single Rune of Stone.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Groth One-Eye
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing the Master Rune of Groth One-Eye confers the Stubborn special rule to the bearer's unit and all friendly Dwarf units within 12" of the bearer.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Stromni Redbeard
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing the Master Rune of Stromni Redbeard confers a further +1 bonus to the bearer's unit's combat result score, and the combat result score of all other friendly Dwarf units within 12" of the bearer.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Valaya
Artefact.Rule: +2 bonus upon all attempts to dispel magic
All Remains in Play spells are immediately dispelled on a D6 roll of 3+ at the start of each friendly Magic phase (roll separately for each Remains in Play spell)
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing the Master Rune of Valaya confers a +2 bonus upon all attempts to dispel magic by the owning player. Additionally, all Remains in Play spells are immediately dispelled on a D6 roll of 3+ at the start of each friendly Magic phase (roll separately for each Remains in Play spell).

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Grungni
Artefact.Rule: 5+ Ward save against Wounds caused by shooting attacks and all magic missiles to any friendly units within 6" of the bearer
Artefact.Description: Battle Standard Bearer only. A standard bearing the Master Rune of Grungni confers a 4+ Ward save to its bearer. Additionally, it confers a 5+ Ward save against Wounds caused by shooting attacks and all magic missiles to any friendly units within 6" of the bearer.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Battle
Artefact.Description:
A standard bearing a Rune of Battle confers a further +1 bonus to the bearer's unit's combat result score.

A standard bearing two Runes of Battle confers a further +2 bonus to the bearer's unit's combat result score.

A standard bearing three Runes of Battle confers a further +2 bonus to the bearer's unit's combat result score, and additionally confers the Fight in Extra Ranks special rule to the bearer's unit.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Slowness
Artefact.Rule: Any foes charging a unit subtract D6" from their charge distance (roll after their charge distance has been determined)
Artefact.Description:
Any foes charging a unit including a standard bearing a Rune of Slowness subtract D6" from their charge distance (roll after their charge distance has been determined). If the enemy fails to make contact, all the rules for failed charges apply.

A second Rune of Slowness means a foe rolls 2D6 and must choose the highest dice when subtracting from his charge distance.

A third Rune of Slowness maintains the previous effects and, should a foe contact the bearing unit, they have the Always Strikes Last special rule in the first round of combat.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Slowness
Artefact.Rule: Any foes charging a unit roll 2D6, choose the highest dice and subtracting from his charge distance (roll after their charge distance has been determined)

Artefact.Name: Rune of Slowness
Artefact.Rule: Any foes charging a unit roll 2D6, choose the highest dice and subtracting from his charge distance (roll after their charge distance has been determined )
A foe contact the bearing unit have the Always Strikes Last special rule in the first round of combat

Artefact.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description:
A standard bearing a Rune of Sanctuary confers the Magic Resistance (1) special rule to the bearer's unit.

A standard bearing two Runes of Sanctuary confers the Magic Resistance (2) special rule to the bearer's unit.

A standard bearing three Runes of Sanctuary confers the Magic Resistance (3) special rule to the bearer's unit.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)

Artefact.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (3)

Artefact.Name: Rune of Stoicism
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing the Rune of Stoicism confers the Stubborn special rule to the bearer's unit.

Artefact.Name: Strollaz' Rune
Artefact.Rule: Vanguard deployment special rule
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing Strollaz' Rune confers the Vanguard deployment special rule to the bearer's unit.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Courage
Artefact.Description: A standard bearing the Rune of Courage confers the Immune to Psychology special rule to the bearer's unit.

Artefact.Name: Ancestor Rune
Artefact.Rule: One use only: Break test on a single D6
Artefact.Description: One use only. Multiples of this rune have no further effect. A standard bearing this rune allows the bearer's unit to take a Break test on a single D6. Once used, the rune is expended.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Balance
Artefact.Rule: During the enemy's Magic phase roll a D6: on 4+ remove one power dice from opponent's pool and add to your dispel pool, Runesmiths/Runelords only
Artefact.Description: Runesmiths/Runelords only. During the enemy's Magic phase, this rune allows the owning player to roll a D6; on a roll of 4+, he can remove one power dice from his opponent's pool and add it to his own dispel pool.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Spite
Artefact.Rule: Every rime a model suffers an unsaved Wound in close combat, the model that inflicted it suffers a Strength 5 hit
Artefact.Description: Every rime a model with the Master Rune of Spite suffers an unsaved Wound in close combat, the model that inflicted it suffers a Strength 5 hit.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Passage
Artefact.Rule: Automatically pass any Dangerous Terrain tests
Artefact.Description: A model with the Master Rune of Passage, and any unit he joins, automatically pass any Dangerous Terrain tests.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Warding
Artefact.Description:
A model with a Rune of Warding has a 6+ Ward save.

A model with two Runes of Warding has a 5+ Ward save.

A model with three Runes of Warding has a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Spellbreaking
Artefact.Rule: One use only. When a spell has been cast, a Runesmith or Runelord can use Spellbreaking rune to dispel it automatically, without the need to roll dispel dice
Artefact.Description: Runesmiths/Runelords only. One use only. When a spell has been cast, a Runesmith or Runelord can use this rune to dispel it automatically, without the need to roll dispel dice. This rune cannot stop a spell cast with irresistible force, and cannot be used to dispel Remains in Play spells other than at the moment they are cast.\n\nA second Rune of Spellbreaking maintains the previous effect and, after the spell is dispelled, roll a D6; on a 4+, the enemy spell is lost to the Wizard casting it and cannot be cast by him for the rest of the game. A third Rune of Spellbreaking has no farther effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Spellbreaking
Artefact.Rule: One use only. When a spell has been cast, a Runesmith or Runelord can use Spellbreaking rune to dispel it automatically, without the need to roll dispel dice, after roll a D6: on a 4+, the enemy spell is lost to the Wizard casting it and cannot be cast by him for the rest of the game
Artefact.Description: Runesmiths/Runelords only. One use only. When a spell has been cast, a Runesmith or Runelord can use this rune to dispel it automatically, without the need to roll dispel dice. This rune cannot stop a spell cast with irresistible force, and cannot be used to dispel Remains in Play spells other than at the moment they are cast.\n\nA second Rune of Spellbreaking maintains the previous effect and, after the spell is dispelled, roll a D6; on a 4+, the enemy spell is lost to the Wizard casting it and cannot be cast by him for the rest of the game. A third Rune of Spellbreaking has no farther effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Luck
Artefact.Rule: One use only: a model can re-roll a single To Hit roll, To Wound roll, armour save, ward save or characteristic test during the game
Artefact.Description: One use only. A model with a Rune of Luck can re-roll a single To Hit roll, To Wound roll, armour save, ward save or characteristic test during the game. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of the Furnace
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against all Wounds with the Flaming Attacks special rule
Artefact.Description: A model with the Rune of the Furnace has a 2+ ward save against all Wounds with the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Immolation
Artefact.Rule: A Dwarf player can at the end of any round of combat before determining the combat results removed the model from play, and each enemy unit in combat with the war machine suffers 2D6 magical Strength 4 hits with the Flaming Attacks special rule, allocated as for shooting
Artefact.Description: One use only. A Dwarf player can cause a war machine engraved with the Master Rune of Immolation to explode at the end of any round of combat before determining the combat results. Both the war machine and all its remaining crew are instantly removed from play, and each enemy unit in combat with the war machine suffers 2D6 magical Strength 4 hits with the Flaming Attacks special rule, allocated as for shooting. Any surviving enemy units who charged that turn may make an overrun move as normal. This rune will also be triggered automatically when the war machine loses its last Wound in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Master Rune of Disguise
Artefact.Rule: A war machine counts as being in hard cover
Artefact.Description: A war machine engraved with the Master Rune of Disguise always counts as being in hard cover.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Penetrating
Artefact.Rule: A war machine engraved with a Rune of Penetration increases the Strength of its shots by 1, to a maximum of 10
Artefact.Description:
A war machine engraved with a Rune of Penetration increases the Strength of its shots by 1, to a maximum of 10.

A war machine engraved with two Runes of Penetration increases the Strength of its shots by 1, to a maximum of 10, and allows the user to re-roll a single failed To Wound roll during the course of the battle.

A third Rune of Penetration has no further effect.

Note that in the case of a Grudge Thrower, this bonus increases the Strength of both Strength values in its profile.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Penetrating
Artefact.Rule: A war machine engraved with a Rune of Penetration increases the Strength of its shots by 1, to a maximum of 10
Can re-roll a single failed To Wound roll during the course of the battle

Artefact.Name: Stalwart Rune
Artefact.Description:
A war machine engraved with a Stalwart Rune confers a +1 bonus to its crew's combat result score.

A war machine engraved with two Stalwart Runes confers a +1 bonus to its crew's combat result score, and its crew also gain the Unbreakable special rule.

A third Stalwart Rune has no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Accuracy
Artefact.Rule: +1 bonus To Hit; if war machine does not use Ballistic Skill To Hit, it can instead re-roll the scatter dice
Artefact.Description: A war machine with engraved with a Rune of Accuracy has a +1 bonus To Hit. If it does not use Ballistic Skill To Hit, it can instead re-roll the scatter dice. If the scatter dice is re-rolled, you must accept the result of the second roll. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Forging
Artefact.Rule: Can re-roll the artillery dice whenever a misfire result is rolled
Artefact.Description: A war machine engraved with a Rune of Forging can re-roll the artillery dice whenever a misfire result is rolled; however, you must accept the result of the second roll. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Flakkson's Rune of Seeking
Artefact.Rule: +1 To Hit against any units with the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: Bolt Throwers only. A war machine engraved with Flakkson's Rune of Seeking gains +1 To Hit against any units with the Fly special rule. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Artefact.Name: Rune of Burning
Artefact.Rule: Flaming Attacks special rule
Artefact.Description: All shooting attacks from a war machine engraved with a Rune of Burning have the Flaming Attacks special rule. Multiples of this rune have no further effect.

Hero.Name: Thorgrim Grudgebearer
Hero.Description: Thorgrim Grudgebearer, High King of Karaz-a-Karak

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
If Thorgrim is slain, all friendly dwarfs models immediately gain the Frenzy special rule

HandWeapon.Name: The Axe of Grimnir
HandWeapon.Rule: Wound any model not in magic armour on a To Wound roll of 2+, regardless of the target's Toughness; against models in magic armour, a roll of 3+ is required
Multiple Wounds (D6) if directed against a Giant or Chaos Giant

Armour.Name: The Armour of Skaldour
Armour.Rule: 2+ Ward save against attacks with the Killing Blow, Heroic Killing Blow or Multiple Wounds

Arcane.Name: The Great Book of Grudges
Arcane.Rule: Enchanted Item. If Thorgrim is on the battlefield when you roll on the Ancestral Grudge table, your army receives a'+3 modifier. If the total is 7 or more, Thorgrim, and any unit he joins, may re-roll failed To Hit rolls in every round of close combat, not just the first

Hero.Name: Thorek Ironbrow
Hero.Description: Thorek Ironbrow, Master Runelord of Karak Azul

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
If vou have one or more Anvils of Doom on the battlefield at tie start of any Magic phase, add one dice to both your power and your dispel pool
Magic resistance (3)
A model mounted on an Anvil of Doom can use each of the Mowing bound spells once per friendly Magic Phase as long he has not moved this turn
Thorek can re-roll a single dice on a failed attempt to cast one of the innate bound spells of the Anvil of Doom per turn
Thorek receives a +1 bonus on all his attempts to cast the Anvil of Doom's bound spells

HandWeapon.Name: Klad Brakak
HandWeapon.Rule: If the victim suffers one or more unsaved Wounds, any magic armour, magic helmets and magic shields they were equipped with are destroyed and cannot be used for the remainder of the game

Hero.Name: Ungrim Ironfist
Hero.Description: Ungrim Ironfist, Last Slayer King of Karak Kadrin

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Any ward saves successfully made against Attacks made by the Slayer must be re-rolled
When attacking monsters, the Slayer's attacks have the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy

If a model is reduced to 0 Wounds by close combat Attacks or Stomps (but not Impact Hits), he can immediately make a single Deathblow attack before he is removed as a casualty; if a model with the Deathblow special rule is slain in a challenge, his Deathblow attack must be directed at the opposing model in the challenge
Slavers ignore penalties to Strength and always cause a Wound on a To Wound roll of 4+
The only units Ungrim Ironfist can join are units of Slayers
Can be chosen as the army General

Armour.Name: Dragon Cloak of Fyrskar
Armour.Rule: 2+ Ward save against all hits with the Flaming Attacks special rule

Hero.Name: Belegar Ironhammer
Hero.Description: Belegar Ironhammer, True King of the Eight Peaks

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
Once per game, at the start of any Close Combat phase, Belegar can harness the power of his ancestors: for the remainder of the turn, he doubles his Attacks characteristic

Armour.Name: Shield of Defiance
Armour.Rule: Immune to the effects of the Killing Blow and Heroic Killing Blow special rules, treating wounding hits that would automatically slay as a normal Wound

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
+1 bonus to any Parry save in a turn in which unit is charged
All friendly infantry models in a unit joined by a Runelord gain the Armour Piercing special rule
Magic resistance (2)
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
+1 bonus to any Parry save in a turn in which unit is charged
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
Any ward saves successfully made against Attacks made by the Slayer must be re-rolled
When attacking monsters, the Slayer's attacks have the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule

If a model is reduced to 0 Wounds by close combat Attacks or Stomps (but not Impact Hits), he can immediately make a single Deathblow attack before he is removed as a casualty; if a model with the Deathblow special rule is slain in a challenge, his Deathblow attack must be directed at the opposing model in the challenge
Ignore penalties to Strength and always cause a Wound on a To Wound roll of 4+

Turn up to battle with a variety of axes; at the start of each combat must choose to fight with either a great axe (great weapon) or a pair of axes (additional hand weapon); if a Slayer has a runic weapon, he loses the benefit of this special rule
Only models with the Slayer special rule are allowed to join units of Slayers
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Any army that includes Bugman can upgrade a single unit of Rangers to be Bugman's Rangers (WS5, BS4 and S4 and cost an additional +3 points per model), Bugman must join the unit and cannot leave it
As long as Bugman is alive, roll 2D6 at the start of each friendly turn and consult the Mowing chart to see what effects his draughts have upon himself and any unit he has currendy joined
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
Scouts

Arcane.Name: Bugman's Tankard
Arcane.Rule: Bugman, or a single model in the same unit, can drink from Bugman's Tankard at the start of any friendly turn: the imbiber immediately recovers D3 Wounds, but cannot surpass his Wounds characteristic

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven

Up to one unit with the troop type war machine can be entrenched for each Master Engineer in the army; an entrenched war machine is treated as being in hard cover when shot at and any charging models suffer a -1 To Hit modifier in close combat

As long as he is not fleeing, at the start of each friendly Shooting phase, roll a D6: jn a 2+, Grimm can bestow one of the following rules on a single friendly unit within 3": Artillery Adjustment, Increased Range, Superior Volley
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
Within 3" of a war machine is allowed to take a "Look Out Sir!" roll just as if he was within 3" of a unit of five or more models of the same troop type as himself

HandWeapon.Name: God Axe
HandWeapon.Rule: If Grimm scores one or more hits in close combat against a model using a magic weapon, roll a D6; on a 5 + , that weapon is immediately destroyed and cannot be used further in this game

RangeWeapon.Name: Grudge-raker
RangeWeapon.Rule: Grudge-raker has range 18", Strength 4, Armour Piercing, Dwarf-crafted, Multiple Shots (2D3)

If the Dwarf General is in a unit of Hammerers, any member of that unit can accept a challenge. This special rule lasts as long as the General is in the unit.

A unit with this special rule can deploy using the Ambushers special rule. Additionally, in the turn in which the unit arrives as Ambushers, they are counted as being in soft cover

Option.Name: Blasting charges
Option.Rule: Missile weapons with one use only rule and range attack with range 4", Strength 4 and Armour Piercing, Flaming Attacks special rules

Option.Name: Steam drill
Option.Rule: Can re-roll a failed arrival for its Ambushers special rule

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
If a model is reduced to 0 Wounds by close combat Attacks or Stomps (but not Impact Hits), he can immediately make a single Deathblow attack before he is removed as a casualty
Slavers ignore penalties to Strength and always cause a Wound on a To Wound roll of 4+, unless they would need a lower result. Use the Slaver's Strength characteristic to determine the armour save
At the start of each combat, a Slayer unit must choose to fight with either a great axe (great weapon) or a pair of axes (additional hand weapon)
Only models with the Slayer special rule are allowed to join units of Slayers

War Machine
Fly
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven

Once per game, during the Remaining Moves sub-phase, models may drop bombs unless they are fleeing or have declared a charge that turn. To Dive Bomb, select one unengaged enemy unit that the Gyrocopter moved over in that turn.
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
War Machine
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
War Machine
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
War Machine

An Organ Gun has the following profile and special rules: Range 30", Strength 5 and Armour Piercing. To fire the Organ Gun, select a target according to the normal rules for shooting, then roll two artillery dice to find out how many shots are fired. If one of the dice rolls a misfire, the firing mechanism is not working properly or it suffers a minor jam. All shots fired from the Organ Gun this turn suffer a -1 To Hit. If both dice roll a misfire, no shots are fired and a critical fault has occurred; roll a D6 and consult the Black Powder War Machine Misfire. The number of shots fired by the Organ Gun is equal to the total of both artillery dice. After determining the number of shots, roll that number of dice To Hit the target using the crew's Ballistic Skill and applying all appropriate modifiers. However, the Organ Gun never suffers a To Hit penalty for firing multiple shots
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
War Machine

Flame Cannons shoot using the fire thrower rules with special rules: Range 12", Strength 5, Flaming Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3). To fire the supercharged flame shot, nominate a point within the war machine's line of sight and within 12". Place a small counter in the correct position, uUsing your tape measure, extend a 'shot' line from the Cannon's barrel all the way to your target point. Roll the artillery dice and extend the fine away from the Cannon the number of inches shown - this is where the teardrop-shaped template is placed. After this, work out hits exactly as per normal fire thrower rules. If you roll a misfire result while shooting a supercharged flame shot, you suffer a -1 penalty on the Black Powder War Machine Misfire chart
